item.title: 文章发表
item.author: 作者
item.description: Our Team Completed Projects In MajorBio & Publications LECT2,a Ligand for Tie1,Plays a Crucial Role in Liver Fibrogenesis Here, we show that leukocyte cell-derived chemotaxin 2 (LECT2) is a functional ligand of Tie1, a poorly characterized endothelial cell (EC)-specific orphan receptor. Upon binding to Tie1, LECT2 interrupts Tie1/Tie2 heterodimerization, facilitates Tie2/Tie2 homodimerization, activates PPAR signaling, and inhibits the migration and tube formations of EC. In vivo studies showed that LECT2
